title: How long will there be Java jobs in the future? - Quora
tags: Jobs and Careers in Computer Programming

response.answer_text: As long as :  Java keeps enriching itself in its category of "general purpose high-level language"Plays out well in coming future w.r.t. to industry shift goes in multitude directions (AI/ML taking over in terms of self- reproducing codes(hearing about it from 90s, languages specific to a domain taking over, a complete paradigm shift of taking over the whole idea of programmers writing codes, etc).All this said, my intuition/calculative guess says that Java is here to stay strong for this and early part of next decade because its widely spread everywhere due to :  - Android, - Web backends, -  Server apps, - Embedded - Big Data, and many others.  Parting thought : Ever dawn has to meet the dusk. Java will  have it too. But it has good time left for meeting it's dusk.
Java programming jobs will always be available in as much that enterprise applications still exist and security is still a concern.
